intro: Lasiorrhiza landbeckii, commonly known as the landbeck's beardtongue, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, often in open woodlands or along streambanks. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in areas with well-drained soil.
